item.title: Is it possible to be an ethical billionaire?
item.description: Contex: Petter Anker Stordalen Bjorvand is a Norwegian businessman. With an estimated net worth of US$1.6 billion as of 2025. Rutger Bregman argues that philanthropy by billionaires often masks deeper structural problems — and that real change has historically come from people willing to challenge the systems that made them rich, not just give some of the money away.

26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: I hadn't done a @Patricbates piece in a while. My favorite imgur artist. Also, I can't resist skeletons.
27 Man Tax: Miles McMillan
“I just know that something good is going to happen. I don't know when — but just saying it could even make it happen.” - Kate Bush So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work, zero income. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've honestly been my lifeline. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me

item.title: I know nothing about everything, but this seems like a great move.
item.description: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani has appointed a former prisoner to run jails. 64-year-old Stanley Richards has been appointed as New York City’s commissioner of the department of correction. He will be the first person who has served time to lead the department. Richards spent two and a half years in Rikers Island - the city’s largest jail - and another four and a half years in state prison for robbery in the late 1980s. He was released from prison in 1991. Since then he has worked helping people prepare for their release from prison and re-entry into society. Mamdani said Richards’ appointment is “a testament to the thought and leadership he will bring to every member of Correction staff and incarcerated New Yorkers underneath his purview”. Richards said: “My experience and journey is a testament that when we provide support, when we centre our collective work to hope instead of fear, when we see the best in all of us instead of judging people in the worst thing we ever done, when we see our commonality [more] than our difference, we can achieve the unimaginable.” Jails are a thorny political issue for Mamdani. Prior to his election, the democratic socialist called for “no new jails”. Now in power, he must oversee the closing of Rikers Island and its replacement with four new prisons.

Pippin tax! Today's message from Pippin: "Peek a boo!" ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin

item.title: Memes that made me laugh this week
item.description:
Welcome to this dump of random memes. Sometimes I make them themed, sometimes I don't. If you enjoy laughing without talking politics, getting away from the horrors of the world, or escaping reality, you’ll love following this page!
This is the reason to have kids, to teach them that mama loves them
We adopted litter mate sisters. I’ve lived to be 8, the other was 17 when she passed way. The first dog was my favorite. Miss that sweet girl.
Maybe it’s the old fashion?
Remember the first time you got glasses and could actually see the leaves on the trees?
Honestly though, cats like chilling in any garden, they don’t know they’re in Florence
Ugh
Sounds like heaven
For real
Yay
I was promised flying cars!
This is my husband. Love that man. He really does coo at our cats.
Why do you want to work here? Because I need money.
Miss my steak Gordita supreme
Literally had this happen yesterday. My mom is so sympathetic.
Why is this so hilarious?
I mean, I could be worse
Ding!
Getting old sucks
I probably would’ve too, but I think The Secret of Nim was about that subject. I don’t really remember, I was 7.
I would’ve DIED to have this
GOOP is stupid
I’ve always wanted beautiful spaghetti hair
Join me!
item.dc:creator: GigglySprinkleCupcake

item.title: GovBrief Today #370
item.description: The Constitution remains under intense pressure from Trump's MAGA movement. Today a federal judge in Oregon halted warrantless ICE arrests after agents testified they create warrants after people are already detained and operate under daily arrest quotas. The judge insisted that great power must exercise great restraint. Today was also the third consecutive day that Donald Trump publicly insisted that the federal government nationalize elections and remove them from state control. He says he's targeting 15 places. Even Republican Senator Thom Tillis said nationalizing elections "seems a little off strategy." The Constitution has been amended 27 times in 250 years. That flexibility allows it to evolve if necessary, but the amendment process is specific. While a federal judge, Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson wrote during the first Trump administration, "Stated simply, the primary takeaway from the past 250 years of recorded American history is that Presidents are not kings." Make sure your representatives, especially those in the Republican Party, know that you demand they defend the Constitution they swore to uphold. We've emailed 5,900+ stories over 370 straight nights. The algorithm doesn't always show them to you. Subscribe now at govbrief.today #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/nike-discrimination [2] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-ga-records [3] https://go.govbrief.today/cia-factbook [4] https://go.govbrief.today/minn-lawyer-removed [5] https://go.govbrief.today/guthrie-trump-fbi [6] https://go.govbrief.today/oregon-warrantless [7] https://go.govbrief.today/routh-life [8] https://go.govbrief.today/scotus-california-map [9] https://go.govbrief.today/mn-pulls-700 [10] https://go.govbrief.today/new-orleans-recruit [11] https://go.govbrief.today/4th-grader-released [12] https://go.govbrief.today/domestic-terrorist-db [13] https://go.govbrief.today/rubio-archives-exit [14] https://go.govbrief.today/meeks-bessent [15] https://go.govbrief.today/29-republicans-quit [16] https://go.govbrief.today/artemis-delay-march [17] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-columbus-statue [18] https://go.govbrief.today/fbi-apple-lockdown [19] https://go.govbrief.today/khanna-uae-crypto [20] https://go.govbrief.today/musk-deposition Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com

item.title: Some Bannon Interesting Texts from the Epstein Files
item.description:
Epstein connecting Bannon to Ken Starr to recommend Gorsuch be Trump's pick for Supreme Court. Wild that they already planned to overturn Chevron years before it happens.
Also they thought it was funny that Justice Gorsuch would be undoing his mother's life work if they used him like this. "Pretty epic, huh?"
Epstein says he say photos of Macron and "his boyfriend." Oddly in most countries they want far right leaders, but they seem fine with Macron in France, maybe because of this.
They hate China, but they also fear Xi to come extent. Here Epstein talks about why.
Planning for Argentina, Venezuela, and Brazil. Note: They meet with Lula and Chomsky. They love Bolsonaro too. They don't always back who you'd think.
They think Musk is a fool who "should not be running a public company."
Trump's obsession with the Nobel Peace Prize obviously goes back for years here. They are well aware of it.
They think all these Middle Eastern leaders are fucked up, but manipulable.
"Massages not included." Also they are scheming to make non-citizen residents the national scapegoat.
They scheme to push out Theresa May, but have trouble getting another Tory to step up, eventually Boris does.
"Trump worst negotiator in human history."
America pulling back from world leadership roles leading to chaos they predict.
Supporting Abe in Japan like Bolsonaro and Orban.
Trump down on Pence earlier than thought. And a bit on Brexit.
More testicles into Macron's Administration in France.
More on Maduro and Venezula, "Oil oil oil"
Worried about Macron's snap election.
"Very stable individual needs all the friends he can get." There's more, about a specific low-level young woman working in the White House who was blowing Trump, and explaining that's why Melania and fam were away while Trump stayed back at the White House for the holidays and more. But I'll have more later. It takes me a little bit to pull out these tidbits.
item.dc:creator: hufflesnuff
